headline: Indian Chicken Curry
description: This creamy Indian chicken curry has an unbeatable combination of flavors thanks to an array of aromatic warm spices, plain yogurt, and coconut milk.

video.description: This homemade Indian chicken curry dish is so delicious, you won‚Äôt miss takeout.
video.name: Indian Chicken Curry II

name: Indian Chicken Curry
recipeIngredient: 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saut√© onion until lightly browned.
Stir in garlic, curry powder, cinnamon, paprika, bay leaf, ginger, sugar, and salt. Continue stirring for 2 minutes.
Add chicken pieces, tomato paste, yogurt, and coconut milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove bay leaf, and stir in lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Simmer 5 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: Curry flavor was overpowering; that's all you could taste. Had high hopes. Sorry to leave a negative rating.
Good. My husband liked it, too. I added some frozen peas, but if you choose to do this, don‚Äôt overdo it. Curry and salt to taste for sure.
gross! WAY to much curry! It turned out bitter and spicy. Cooked the chicken forever and still was raw.

I thought this recipe was tasty and easy to make. I decreased the cinnamon by half because my cinnamon is very strong. Also I used only 2 tablespoons of regular curry powder and 1/2 tablespoons of hot curry powder and so I omitted the cayenne. I was afraid the spices would be too much. You can always add if needed but didn‚Äôt need more. Also I added the whole can of coconut milk. You can remove the chicken and continue to simmer the sauce to make it thicker which I liked. Maybe other recipes are better but I‚Äôll come back to this one. Btw, I could taste the lemon and I didn‚Äôt think it was too much. Again you could use less at first and taste your sauce.
Very good but I did add some tin tomatoes and green üå∂ cooked chicken separately to get water out of it I have just made this and loved it

Great recipe. Simple and not too fussy. Made it a few times. I put a few seeds in with the onions (cumin, fenugreek and fennel) and add garam masala and more coconut Juice. I am experimenting with chicken thighs (cheaper).
Delicious 1st time I made curry chicken
This is going to be our go-to chicken curry. I have been trying and just missing. This was a hit. I only left out the lemon juice. Delicious.

This turned out delicious! I did cook the chicken first then removed to a bowl while I cooked the onion and garlic, then added the yogurt and coconut milk and then the seasonings. I added the chicken back in and simmered according to the rest of the recipe. I was very pleased with how it turned out and will definitely make again.
Wow! Very rich and bold flavors. I added 1/4 teaspoon more red chili pepper to give it a nice kick. This is definitely an Indian curry!

The flavor was great, but this recipe needs some modification. For starters, if you add the spices to a dry pan as written, they'll burn and you'll get a smokey mess. Instead, add them with the yogurt and coconut milk. Also, there is too much liquid released from the chicken. I simmered for an extra 15 minutes, but it was still way too liquidy- and this was before the lemon juice was added. I had to make a cornstarch slurry to thicken it up. The flavor was great though- serve over rice.
Fantastic and so delicious!
great one! I have been cooking it for the past 8years, still love it! sometimes I like to add frozen peas in to the pan towards the end.
This is a go to recipe for me. I usually double it which uses the entire can of coconut milk. I make it as written.

This was a really great recipe. However, because I‚Äôm me‚Ä¶I made just a few adjustments. I used a lime instead of a lemon (because limes are usually bitter, I thought it would be a great substitute for this dish, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint)! I didn‚Äôt have tomato paste so I used pizza sauce instead (I know, I know, it sounds weird but it‚Äôs a REALLY great red sauce with a lot of flavor). I didn‚Äôt have coconut milk (surprisingly, I always keep it on hand), so I substituted it for cream cheese and milk (made it really creamy and I was SOOO impressed). I used a little more sugar than the recipe called for, used white and brown sugar. If you‚Äôre are a curry lover‚Ä¶you HAVE to try this!! üòÅ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•
The Indian chicken curry was delicious. I used honey yogurt and omitted the sugar. Thanks for sharing the recipe. I will definitely make it again.

I love curry, but this was a different than my usual dish. More spice, more flavor..just so good. The only difference was I cut the cayenne in half ..think I am glad I did, but perhaps I will add it next time to be sure‚Ä¶ ? Hubby loved it to. I think I am expanding his Minnesota palate! Try it and enjoy.

As it is, this is a very watery and bland curry. I doctored it by adding Garam Masala, extra salt and curry powder. I omitted the lemon juice and cayenne. I also cooked it much longer to thicken the sauce. My husband enjoyed it, but I wasn‚Äôt a fan. I make a lot of curries and won‚Äôt be making this one again.
I'm not sure what went wrong.. I can't say the recipe was bad, but it didn't come out well.

Delicious, absolutely Delicious. I didn't change anything about it and my family and I gobbled it right up. Personally, i would suggest doubling or even tripling the recipe, as i had doubled the recipe so i would have leftovers the next day, but it had already all been eaten. This was super easy to make, and had just the right amount of spice where my mouth didn't feel like it was on fire, but i still got the taste of the spices and it didn't feel bland. I got a lot of mixed signals about the taste and authenticity but this curry proved to be delicious. ‚ô•Ô∏é
Loved this curry recipe, excellent. I will definitely make again. We are keto, so served it over broccoli, but will try over riced cauliflower next time!
It was simple to make. Very flavorful and tasty.
Decent. Next time I'd use chicken thighs and simmer it longer to thicken the sauce. I'm a medium spice kind of person - I'd dial back the cayenne to 1/4 t.
Not much flavor. Very disappointed.
This is my go to Chicken Curry recipe. It's easy to make and delicious.

Very good! But I did have to make some tweaks. This recipe is quite muted in flavor, so I doubled the curry powder and cayenne. I also cooked the spices. To allow them to cook a little more and not be so grainy (raw) feeling on the palate, I added a half cup of water before the coconut milk/yogurt, covered, and allowed everything to meld together. I also simmered mine altogether for another 25-30 min (for a total cook time of 1hr20min). It turned out sooo good!!

It is yummy. I served it over rice and I doubled the recipe. I also added peas, as some other reviewers suggested. Since I didn't have any coconut milk, I used sour cream instead. So I didn't add the lemon. Also left out the cayenne because I'm not a fan of very spicy food. It had enough of a kick from the curry. I also let it stew for quite a while, so the meat was very tender. I'll probably try it again with chapatis because I think they would taste great together.

The recipe was okay, but needs tweaking. I made it as - is. It is dry/gritty as many say, if you make it according to the directions. The seasonings are dry and overwhelming, not nearly as creamy as it should be. More liquid, maybe more coconut milk, is very much needed.
Halved the cinnamon and could use a little more salt. Very good!!
Fantastic
Omg, this is probably the best curry I have ever made. Husband loved it and asked for seconds. Thank you
Great flavors in this curry and it has a nice consistency.

Good starting point. Double the curry, half reg, half hot madras. Add 1 tsp. Garam Masada, get it from an Indian spice store. Mccormick isn't the same. Use 5% greek yogurt. Mmnn. A lot more garlic too.
I really liked it a lot! Mine got really thick, so I ended up adding regular milk. I threw some cashew pieces in it at the end. Will definitely make it again.
I was surprised at how easy this was, and very tasty!

So easy and incredibly delicious!! I used chicken thigh instead of breast and the meat was so tender. Might need to add a bit more salt, and cayenne at the end if you wish to have some spice. Top with a few raisins and chopped dried apricots too!
It was ok but not much flavor to it. I've had many curries and this one is definitely at the bottom
this recipe was just perfect for my family i cooked rice with it and it was wonderful the prefect amount of spice

I found this recipe very sweet and western or white washed for lack of a better term... this is the first recipe from this site I have not enjoyed... I would maybe tweak it with garam masala or chili powder ... I will try again with modifications.. no offense to the creator, its just not what I expected...
It didn‚Äôt turn out how I would have liked it to.but everyone else loved it
Quick and easy! I'm not normally a curry person, but did enjoy this.
added some sour cream
I added slurry to thicken! I also used chicken thighs.
Was great curry

I used veggie oil instead of olive bc of another comment that said it was better to pull out the flavors of the spices (you don‚Äôt want an olive flavor). I guess I was thinking this would taste more like a buttered chicken Indian dish.. I was okay but will probably never make this dish again. Wasn‚Äôt my favorite.. it tasted like something was missing and the tomato paste flavor was so strong even tho I only used a tablespoon..

Classic & Wonderful. 
Due to small children, I substituted 4 oz of canned green chilis for the cayenne pepper (flavor without the heat). I also added a 1/2 Cup of chicken broth because I let mine simmer too long & it got too thick. But it needs NO changes. For adults it is really a perfectly spiced curry recipe!
I followed it exactly and it was perfect.
It was really easy to make! I had everything on hand but had to use vanilla yogurt, it still tasted amazing!

I followed what "The Gangrel" wrote and used whole spices at the start - cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and cloves; I fried them in a bit of oil, but I don't often cook with whole spices so wasn't sure whether to take them out or leave them in.. I took them out and then added the garlic, ginger, and onion into the oil that has been infused with the whole spices. Then I added my ground spices as per the recipe. I then pushed all of that aside and added the chicken in the same pan to brown. I actually added about 1/2 cup of canned chopped tomatoes and much less coconut milk than suggested. Very tasty!
Very good! I‚Äôve made this recipe several times.

This was a big hit with our family. After reading several reviews and seeing what I had on-hand for ingredients I made several adjustments... and the recipe gets credit for being so easy to change to your personal taste. Left out the cayenne pepper (spicy enough for us without it); also left out the lemon and tomato paste and used a full can of coconut milk in place of the plain yogurt because I didn't have any. Toasted the seasonings in a dry pan first before adding the onion and garlic. Added sliced carrots and peas. Let it simmer for 45+ minutes while I made naan bread (recipe also from this site) and rice.
I thought it was ok, but my family didn't like it.
very good! loved the flavors. I added potatoes and carrots. definitely will make this a hff sin

This was fantastic! My only changes were based on several reviews: I toasted the spices before adding the oil, onion, & garlic (I did not use whole spices, just ground as in recipe) & added diced boiled potatoes & frozen peas. I used boneless chicken thighs because that's what I had and they worked great. Next time, I'll double the amount of meat. I ended up with lots of sauce, which I froze for future veggie meal. Thanks for sharing!
Loved this recipe, it was awesome!!! Will certainly make it again for sure!
A bit bland for me
I love it ??
added mushrooms, other than that I stuck with the recipe.

Found this recipe after my wife dared me to use some random ingredients in our pantry to cook with (coconut cream, crushed tomatoes). Turned out great. I used the amount of curry called for and thought it was enough for me (and I'm not a stranger to Indian food). I did add a heaping teaspoon of garam masala and about 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger (didn't have fresh) and omitted the cinnamon since that's in the garam masala already. I also followed the common recommendation to toast the dry ingredients before adding the onion and chicken (I seasoned the chicken with garlic powder, salt, and some garam masala). I substituted the coconut milk for coconut cream and used the whole can. I also substituted crushed tomatoes (maybe 1/4 cup worth?) for the tomato paste and then cooked everything down for about 30 min. I omitted the lemon juice and yogurt (felt like the thicker coconut accomplished the same task). I would definitely make this again as described.

I am opening a bowl business in Costa Rica, and found that receipe online , And Really that receipe .. WAW ! Each time i try that Bowl , it s amazing !!!!!! The best meal i ate in my life ! i wont change anything in the Receipe . Explosions of flavour , and the taste stay like 20min after finishing on the lips . would highhhhhhhhhhhlt recommmended it!
I added 5 Tbsp curry powder. It was delicious and tasty. My son who doesn‚Äôt eat spicy actually enjoyed this. Thank you for sharing. I‚Äôll be making it again!

I have the recipe 3 stars because I didn‚Äôt follow the recipe fully. I followed the recipe outline.... but I followed one of the comments here for the actions, and THIS WAS THE BEST CURRY I HAVE EVER HAD THE PLEASURE OF PUTTING IN MY MOUTH! I used all the spices from the actual recipe. I cooked all the spices in the oil first really hot. I used 2 (fresh) bay leaves from my garden. In my own preference I used more grated ginger, browned the onions a little more, used sheep yogurt, a whole lemon, added cumin and a little bit of turmeric, added some water after everything to make it less thick. I used cayanne and added a little bit of red pepper flakes and it was just on the cusp of too Spicey for me. It was perfect. I was pleasantly sweating. It was even better the next day at breakfast when I fried a couple of eggs and kale and poured the left over curry on top of it. SO MUCH YUMMMM. DEFINITELY MAKING AGAIN next time with some cloves and maybe some nutmeg and cardamom.

This is a very good recipe for curry. It was simple and easy to follow. I did, however, substitute chicken thighs for chicken breast and added more cayenne pepper than what was called for. This, also, pairs nicely with Prosecco.

This is a good recipe but I like a sweet curry and it had some heat with the cayenne pepper. 1/2 the amount of cayenne would have been better. Since I added sweet potatoes and green beans, I doubled the sauce which I am glad I did. Next time, I would add coconut cream instead of milk to get more of the coconut flavor.
Very good, my husband loved it. I pretty much doubled everything
Easy to prepare , spicy not too hot curry. First one that I made actually. Tune it with amount of cayenne pepper and fix fire with more rice if you have one)
I made this just now it was super easy and incredibly delicious! Made basmati rice and garlic naan to go with it. I doubled the curry powder and the cayenne pepper because I wanted it hot!

I worked with a lady from India who used to make me curry chicken with Naan bread. I haven't had it in years but decided to see if I could make it myself. I found this recipe and it sounded similar to the ingredients she used. I followed the recipe but also used a reviewer's comments and increased the curry to 8 tablespoons and used Indian red chili powder (found it on Amazon). It is a very hot dish, but it tasted EXACTLY like hers! I am so thankful that I found this!
top
Delicious, I think I added too much yogurt though
Made it exactly to the directions and it was terrible! So so disappointing

This was delicious. I added some potatoes, cauliflower and a few green beans. I also added chicken broth so my spices wouldn't burn in the pan so it ended up being saucier but the chicken was shredding. Mmm... so good.
Outstanding recipe! Made it for the family for Valentine‚Äôs Day and it was a huge hit. They have already requested I make it again.
I loved the recipe because it is easy to do. Since we don't like bay leaves I let that out. I find cayenne too hot if uncooked so instead of adding it at the end I add it at the start
It was a little to hot for my taste. But maybe the left overs will be better after the flavors meld. I would make it again but I would add peas.

Love this quick and easy recipe 
But I add more Cayenne pepper because I like my curry just a little bit spicier, and also no yogurt I used heavy whipping cream instead, for delicious
excellent and easy!!!!

Cooked this meal and tasted it 30 minutes ago. 

I followed the recipe exactly. Unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt taste great. I feel like if I had more experienced taste buds, I could alter the recipe to my liking. Since I don‚Äôt, I likely won‚Äôt try this one again.
I made it with no changes except adding a little extra cayenne pepper, because I like it a little spicier. Turned out great!
Added saut√©ed chicken which was very good
I used a garlic, ginger paste and Maharaja curry powder. It was awesome! Thanks gor this one!
Very good, the hubby loves it...

Very good recipe. Easy to make and the family loves it. I use chicken thighs and add more curry powder. One trick I do is I make it the night before and refrigerate it so it all mells together. Most of the time not all of it makes it to the next night. I then reheat it and serve with jasmine rice. Regarding heat, more cayenne is good, but my wife doesn‚Äôt like as much heat as my sons and so we add hot sauce like a good scorpion sauce or habanero. I‚Äôve turned other people onto this recipe specifically in my cooking club and all have thoroughly enjoyed it. I think next time I make it, tonight, I‚Äôll try frying the spices like the one reviewer said.

Great for meal-prep. I first toasted the seasonings separately as others suggested (though I still used the powered stuff). I also sauteed the chicken separately, browning it and creating a fond in the pan, in which I then cooked the rest of the dish. Tweaked the seasoning ratios to my taste.
It was delicious but I added raisins
omitted the sugar, salt, and lemon juice. added chopped carrots, a pepper, and chickpeas. amazing!

I made it because of the many 5 star reviews. I'm not an amateur cook and I followed it exactly. It turned out bitter and gritty. I'm not sure where the bitterness came from, maybe the cinnamon? No idea. I think the order of cooking is incorrect as well - hence the gritty texture. Do yourself a favour - if you're going to make it, make sure you read all the reviews before doing so.
Sooo good! I used coconut milk and coconut cream and added potato carrot celery and red peppers
Excellent recipe. I didn‚Äôt make any changes and will definitely make this again.
I didn't have tomato paste so I left it out. I loved it and I think I will leave it again again next time.

I have 3 other favorite curry recipes, one by an Indian Chef. I have to say, this one is my favorite. I added mushrooms and red bell peppers that I saut√©ed with the onions. I could see how it would work using vegetables of your choice. I even thought about making it with tofu and vegetables. I don't see how anyone can give it one star. It's delicious.
Excellent and easy.... delicious
Great flavor, does require a lot of Curry Powder, but worth it
First recipe I've made on the app and it was amazing. Great flavors the only thing I did different was use spicy curry power over regular.
So delicious! A great balance of spices. One of the best curries I‚Äôve made. Will defiantly be making again! Thank you
yummy
It tasted great! However, how might I adjust the recipe so that you end up with more curry sauce?
Pretty easy and everyone loved it! Have made it twice since first trying it.
I usually convert these recipes to Vegan and they turn out good but this curry sauce was not edible. Maybe I did something wrong.
